value.halfverse: do not keep still nor hold your peace, O God;
value.verse: O God, do not be silent; *

value.halfverse: and those who hate you have lifted up their heads.
value.verse: For your enemies are in tumult, *
They take secret counsel against your people *
value.halfverse: and plot against those whom you protect.

value.verse: They have said, “Come, let us wipe them out from among the nations; *
value.halfverse: let the name of Israel be remembered no more.”
they have made an alliance against you:

value.verse: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; *

value.halfverse: the Philistines and those who dwell in Tyre.

value.verse: The Assyrians also have joined them, *
value.halfverse: and have come to help the people of Lot.
to Sisera, and to Jabin at the river of Kishon:
value.verse: Do to them as you did to Midian, *

value.halfverse: they became like dung upon the ground.

value.verse: Make their leaders like Oreb and Zeëb, *
value.halfverse: and all their commanders like Zebah and Zalmunna,

value.verse: Who said, “Let us take for ourselves *
value.halfverse: the fields of God as our possession.”

value.verse: O my God, make them like whirling dust *
value.halfverse: and like chaff before the wind;
like the flame that sets mountains ablaze.
value.verse: Like fire that burns down a forest, *

value.halfverse: and terrify them with your storm;

value.verse: Cover their faces with shame, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: that they may seek your Name.
let them be put to confusion and perish.
value.verse: Let them be disgraced and terrified for ever; *

value.halfverse: you alone are the Most High over all the earth.
value.verse: Let them know that you, whose Name is YAHWEH, *
